result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court adjourns sentencing for verification of DHS involvement.  Bond continues  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant STUART GILCHRIST in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Amanda Lynn Folger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights compliance. Possible DAA. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

You shall report for fingerprinting and photos pursuant to Wis Stats 970.02(7) to room 15, lower level of the Courthouse.  Due to COVID-19 you will need to call 920-236-4906 BEFORE reporting.  Comply with DHS recommendations.    NO VIOLENT CONTACT/PHYSICAL ALTERCATION OR HITTING OR PHYSICAL DISCIPLINE OF V-1 (OPD #22-7244)
Defendant appears with Atty. Matthew Goldin.  State appears by ADA Amanda Folger.  Advised of rights, has criminal complaint.  Victim rights complied with.
